description.summary: Arabic demon or monster from Islamic and pre-Islamic folklore. Graveyard-dwelling, shape-shifting creature that lures travelers, eats corpses, and takes beautiful or demonic forms. Type of jinn classified as demonic/evil.
description.full: The Ghul (Arabic: غول) is a demon or monster from Arabic and Islamic tradition, known for dwelling in graveyards, luring travelers in the desert, and consuming corpses and human flesh. In Islamic tradition, the Ghul is classified as a type of jinn - a being made of smokeless fire with free will, but one that has chosen evil. The creature is capable of shape-shifting, often appearing as a beautiful woman (Ghula) to lure victims, or manifesting in demonic, terrifying form. Ghuls inhabit desolate places - graveyards, ruins, and desert wildernesses - and are known to ambush travelers, lead them astray, and devour them. The Ghul can be defeated by striking it twice in the same spot, or through decapitation. The Arabic word 'ghūl' is the etymological root of the English word 'ghoul,' though the Western concept has diverged significantly from the original Arabic tradition.
